response.message: Not Android nor Symbian, Windows boy here... what ya got?
Great work! Is there any chance of getting Today view extensions for the app? It'd be nice to have my recent achievements/inbox notifs there.

`•If you’re a Windows Phone pioneer, check out this meta discussion.`...

This thread is not even active, there's little reponse from people at SO, I really regret that even iPad gets more priority than Windows Phone. Having developed Windows Phone apps myself I know it's not insuperable.

- A sad WP user :)

Just downloaded it. It's fantastic - the best way to get SE. THANK YOU!

One quick question though - how do you increase the font size? And, if there isn't a way to do so yet, can you add it? I recommend looking at The Guardian app for a good example of having a discreet (and discrete! ha ha!) ever-present font size controller on each page.

Ah okay, this explains why I kept getting repeated notifications on both Android and iOS apps.

Good job with the update.

Nice work.

Even I always fail to use Stack Exchange on iPad, the community definitely needed this.
Great work! Programming is going mobile!

Nice.

It would be nice to get some BlackBerry application later, too!
Please add a Windows Phone app :)
I need windows phone version.

I use the Android version and the last update really messed it up. When I scroll down on the answers, the answers get all messed up- like they appear and disappear and seem all skewed. It's basically unusable.
I do post a lot of answers from the app, and this update makes it easier. Thanks a lot.
When are you guys going to write a Windows store app?

I apologize as it is relevant to the blog post you have published but a very frustrating thing for me
Is there any change you have recently made to stackoverflow. I could not find Votes tab to sort the questions by votes. I tried to use sort=votes querystring but it is still sorting the latest.
For e.g. 
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/signalr?sort=votes

This is extremely frustrating as sorting by votes is a very useful thing to learn about a new technology.
I great post. thanks again...

It is a strong anti-inflammatory. You will feel and look younger should you like a 4 oz glass of red wine, or a Resveratrol supplement. To savor all the great things about Resveratrol you would need to drink several bottles of wine each day, but by going for a supplement, that is eliminated.
